member.name: T:Snowflake.Configuration.ConfigurationDescriptorCache
member.summary: Provides a thread-safe cache for collection descriptors. Since descriptors use heavy attribute access, the descriptor cache caches the attributes for types that will not change throughout the lifetime of the application.

member.summary: Gets a new or existing section descriptor
member.typeparam: The type of the configuration section

member.summary: Gets a new or existing collection descriptor
member.typeparam: The type of the configuration collection

member.name: T:Snowflake.JsonConverters.JsonCreationConverter`1
member.summary: Base Generic JSON Converter that can help quickly define converters for specific types by automatically generating the CanConvert, ReadJson, and WriteJson methods, requiring the implementer only to define a strongly typed Create method.

member.summary: Gives a chance to transform the object before being serialized
member.returns: The transformed object graph to be serialized

member.name: M:Snowflake.JsonConverters.JsonCreationConverter`1.CanConvert(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines if this converted is designed to deserialization to objects of the specified type.
member.returns: True if the type is supported.

summary.para: Provides helper methods for building and for use in implementations.
Enables use of underscore methods for "SeedBuilder syntax". Import this class with a using static directive.
Use to begin a seed tree, and to continue for nested seeds.
Remember that top-level seeds can be and other awaitables.

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder.AwaitableSeeds(Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTreeAwaitable[])
member.summary: Begins a seed tree result with multiple top-level results. Top-level seeds can be awaitable. Use Seed Builder Syntax rather than the full call.
member.param: The list of seed results to return

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder.WithSeeds(Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTree[])
member.summary: Continues a seed tree result with a list of nested results. Nested seeds can not be awaitable, but can be returned from an asynchronous context. Use Seed Builder Syntax rather than the full call.
member.param: The list of seed results to return
member.returns: The nested portion of a seed tree result.

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder._(Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTreeAwaitable[])
member.summary: Begins a seed tree result with multiple top-level results. Top-level seeds can be awaitable.
member.param: The list of seed results to return

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder.__(Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTree[])
member.summary: Continues a seed tree result with multiple nested seeds.
member.param: The list of seed results to return
member.returns: The nested portion of a seed tree result.

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder._(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTree})
member.summary: Begins a seed tree result with a single top level seed. Top-level seeds can be awaitable.
member.param: The list of seed results to return

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder._(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a single seed result.

member.name: M:Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedBuilder.__(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Snowflake.Scraping.Extensibility.SeedTree})
member.summary: Continues a seed tree result with a single nested seed. Nested seeds must not be awaitable, but can be returned from an asynchronous context.
member.param: The list of seed results to return
